TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit XamlWriter extends System.Object
public ref class XamlWriter abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides a single static method (multiple overloads) that can be used for limited XAML serialization of provided run-time objects into XAML markup.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The serialization enabled by this method has a series of limitations. This is because the serialization enabled is explicitly run-time, and does not have access to possible design-time information in the original XAML (if any). For details, see [Serialization Limitations of XamlWriter.Save](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/serialization-limitations-of-xamlwriter-save.md).
Calling <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter.Save%2A> is not permitted when running in partial trust. This includes from XBAPs.
## Examples The following example serializes a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> into a string using the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter> class. The string is then deserialized back into a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> using the static <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader.Load%2A> method on the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader> class.
[!code-csharp[XamlReaderWriterSnippets#XamlReaderLoadXmlReader](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XamlReaderWriterSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#xamlreaderloadxmlreader)] [!code-vb[XamlReaderWriterSnippets#XamlReaderLoadXmlReader](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XamlReaderWriterSnippets/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#xamlreaderloadxmlreader)]

Docs.summary: Returns XAML either directly or through an object intermediary that serializes the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string Save (object obj);
.method public static hidebysig string Save(object obj) cil managed
Public Shared Function Save (obj As Object) As String
public: static System::String ^ Save(System::Object ^ obj);
static member Save : obj -> string

Docs.param: The element to be serialized. Typically, this is the root element of a page or application.
Docs.summary: Returns a XAML string that serializes the specified object and its properties.
Docs.returns: A XAML string that can be written to a stream or file. The logical tree of all elements that fall under the provided element will be serialized.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The serialization enabled by this method has a series of limitations. This is because the serialization enabled is explicitly run-time, and does not have access to possible design-time information in the original XAML (if any). For details, see [Serialization Limitations of XamlWriter.Save](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/serialization-limitations-of-xamlwriter-save.md).
Calling <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter.Save%2A> is not permitted when running in partial trust.
## Examples The following example serializes a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> into a string using the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter> class. The string is then deserialized back into a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> using the static <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader.Load%2A> method on the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader> class.

Docs.exception: The application is not running in full trust.

static member Save : obj * System.IO.Stream -> unit

Docs.param: The element to be serialized. Typically, this is the root element of a page or application.
Destination stream for the serialized XAML information.
Docs.summary: Saves XAML information into a specified stream to serialize the specified object and its properties.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The serialization enabled by this method has a series of limitations. This is because the serialization enabled is explicitly run-time, and does not have access to possible design-time information in the original XAML (if any). For details, see [Serialization Limitations of XamlWriter.Save](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/serialization-limitations-of-xamlwriter-save.md).
Calling <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter.Save%2A> is not permitted when running in partial trust.
## Examples The following example serializes a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> into a <xref:System.IO.MemoryStream> using the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter> class. The stream is then deserialized back into a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> using the static <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader.Load%2A> method on the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader> class.
[!code-csharp[XamlReaderWriterSnippets#XamlReaderLoadXmlReader](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XamlReaderWriterSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#xamlreaderloadxmlreader)] [!code-vb[XamlReaderWriterSnippets#XamlReaderLoadXmlReader](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XamlReaderWriterSnippets/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#xamlreaderloadxmlreader)]

Docs.exception: The application is not running in full trust.

Docs.param: The element to be serialized. Typically, this is the root element of a page or application.
A instance as the destination where the serialized XAML information is written.
Docs.summary: Saves XAML information as the source for a provided object. The output of the can then be used to serialize the provided object and its properties.
